en: Interview with Roxana Ungureanu, resident of Gatlinburg, conducted by Christian David Rivera. Ungureanu discusses her experience during the fire, and shares some of the difficulties faced by the Romanian community in Gatlinburg. She also explains the current challenges presented by COVID-19. This is a representative quote from the interview: She sent me a video, how the fires are around that hotel. Which, the hotel is in town, you know, it's five minutes from my house. I can see it from here, I'm actually looking at it from my house. And then I showed that to my friends like, "hey, guys, watch this." I feel that time for me, everything was a joke. I didn't think it was gonna, you know, be like that until I saw the damage a few days after, when I started crying actually, and realized that everything was so serious.
Individuals (tourists or locals) directly affected by the fire

Interview with Roxana Ungureanu, resident of Gatlinburg, conducted by Christian David Rivera. Ungureanu discusses her experience during the fire, and shares some of the difficulties faced by the Romanian community in Gatlinburg. She also explains the current challenges presented by COVID-19. This is a representative quote from the interview: She sent me a video, how the fires are around that hotel. Which, the hotel is in town, you know, it's five minutes from my house. I can see it from here, I'm actually looking at it from my house. And then I showed that to my friends like, "hey, guys, watch this." I feel that time for me, everything was a joke. How did you find your way to Gatlinburg from Romania?
Can you tell us about your life in Gatlinburg, such as your family, employment, or community involvement?
Are you in school or working?
What does it feel like to be part of the Romanian community that has developed in Gatlinburg?
What area of Gatlinburg do you live in? What is it like?
What were the days before the fires like? Had you noticed any smoke or heard any news from the city?
During the time when you found out about the fire, at what point did you become truly concerned about the fires?
Were you able to keep in touch with the rest of your friends and the community?
How would you assess the recovery efforts? How do you think the first responders, the city, or FEMA did in helping people or warning people?
How did the event affect you and the Romanian community both emotionally and financially?
How did the event affect you and the Romanian community both emotionally and financially?
Was the Romanian community affected in terms of housing by the fires?
Those two people that lost their homes, did they stay in Gatlinburg?
Do you think that the fires brought the Romanian community closer together?
How has the COVID-19 pandemic affected your life and the Romanian community?
Did anything good or surprising come out of the fires?
Is there anything else that we haven't discussed that you would like to share?
Have you made a plan in case something like this happens again?

seo.title: Interview with Roxana Ungureanu, 2021-03-24 - Rising From the Ashes Oral Histories
